thread.title: Platini admits no written contract for FIFA payment: report
thread.title_full: Platini admits no written contract for FIFA payment: report - World - Sports - Ahram Online

author: english.ahram.org.eg
title: Platini admits no written contract for FIFA payment: report
text:
Related English FA suspends support for Platini's FIFA candidacy UEFA 'fully supports' Michel Platini: Austrian FA head Michel Platini, president of European football body UEFA and suspended amid a huge corruption scandal rocking the game, admitted Monday there was no written contract for remuneration he received from world body FIFA.
FIFA's suspended president Sepp Blatter said last week that a $2.0 million dollar payment made to Platini in 2011 was "a gentleman's agreement."
Platini told French daily Le Monde the deal was made "man to man" but that he understood that under Swiss law "an oral contract is worth a written contract".
